resources.string: View is a basic component that appears on the screen and can be used to interact with the user. The following are examples of the most commonly used derived components of View.

TextView is a basic user interface element that displays text to the user. It is one of the most basic and commonly used views in Android development. Below are some key points and examples related to TextView:

ImageView is a UI component used to display images to the user. It can display images from various sources, such as drawable resources, files, or URLs. Here are some details and examples for working with ImageView:

Button is a UI component that the user can tap to perform an action, such as submitting a form, navigating to another screen, or triggering some other event. Buttons are highly customizable and can include text, images, or a combination of both.

EditText in Android is a UI component that allows users to enter and edit text. It is commonly used in forms, search fields, and other areas where text input is required. EditText extends the TextView class, providing additional functionality for user input.

Spinner is a dropdown list that allows users to select an item from a set of options. It’s similar to a dropdown menu in HTML. Spinner is useful when you have a list of options that don’t take up much space on the screen.
